intro: Cleome chapalensis subsp. albipetala, commonly known as the white-petaled cleome, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that range from white to pink. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its leaves are alternate and palmately lobed, while the stems are hairy and branching. The flowers are borne in clusters and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
